psalm.text:
[[Ps 145,1]]I will extol you, O my God and King,
and I will bless your name forever and ever.
[[Ps 145,2]]Every day will I bless you,
and I will praise your name forever and ever.

[[Ps 145,8]]The LORD is gracious and merciful,
slow to anger and of great kindness.
[[Ps 145,9]]The LORD is good to all 
and compassionate toward all his works.

[[Ps 145,10]]Let all your works give you thanks, O LORD, 
and let your faithful ones bless you.
[[Ps 145,11]]Let them discourse of the glory of your Kingdom 
and speak of your might.

[[Ps 145,13]]The LORD is faithful in all his words
and holy in all his works.
[[Ps 145,14]]The LORD lifts up all who are falling
and raises up all who are bowed down.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Lc 19,1]]At that time, Jesus came to Jericho and intended to pass through the town.
[[Lc 19,2]]Now a man there named Zacchaeus, who was a chief tax collector and also a wealthy man,
[[Lc 19,3]]was seeking to see who Jesus was; but he could not see him because of the crowd, for he was short in stature.
[[Lc 19,4]]So he ran ahead and climbed a sycamore tree in order to see Jesus, who was about to pass that way.
[[Lc 19,5]]When he reached the place, Jesus looked up and said to him, "Zacchaeus, come down quickly, for today I must stay at your house."
[[Lc 19,6]]And he came down quickly and received him with joy.
[[Lc 19,7]]When they all saw this, they began to grumble, saying, "He has gone to stay at the house of a sinner."
[[Lc 19,8]]But Zacchaeus stood there and said to the Lord, "Behold, half of my possessions, Lord, I shall give to the poor, and if I have extorted anything from anyone I shall repay it four times over."
[[Lc 19,9]]And Jesus said to him, "Today salvation has come to this house because this man too is a descendant of Abraham.
[[Lc 19,10]]For the Son of Man has come to seek and to save what was lost."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke

first_reading.text:
[[Sg 11,22]]Before the LORD the whole universe is as a grain from a balance or a drop of morning dew come down upon the earth.
[[Sg 11,23]]But you have mercy on all, because you can do all things; and you overlook the sins of men that they may repent.
[[Sg 11,24]]For you love all things that are and loathe nothing that you have made; for what you hated, you would not have fashioned.
[[Sg 11,25]]And how could a thing remain, unless you willed it; or be preserved, had it not been called forth by you?
[[Sg 11,26]]But you spare all things, because they are yours, O LORD and lover of souls,
[[Sg 12,1]]for your imperishable spirit is in all things!
[[Sg 12,2]]Therefore you rebuke offenders little by little, warn them, and remind them of the sins they are committing, that they may abandon their wickedness and believe in you, O LORD!
first_reading.title: Book of Wisdom

second_reading.title: Second Letter to the Thessalonians
second_reading.text:
[[2_Th 1,11]]Brothers and sisters: we always pray for you, that our God may make you worthy of his calling and powerfully bring to fulfillment every good purpose and every effort of faith,
[[2_Th 1,12]]that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you, and you in him, in accord with the grace of our God and Lord Jesus Christ.
[[2_Th 2,1]]We ask you, brothers, with regard to the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our assembling with him,
[[2_Th 2,2]]not to be shaken out of your minds suddenly, or to be alarmed either by a "spirit," or by an oral statement, or by a letter allegedly from us to the effect that the day of the Lord is at hand.
